description.narrative: Trilateral Cooperation on Biogas and Solar - Transitioning to Sustainable Energy Uses in public and private institutions including in the Agro-Industry in Sri Lanka - China – Ethiopia.

activity-description.narrative: The Project establishes a mechanism for trilateral and South-South Cooperation to address sustainable development challenges related to international cooperation, access to energy for improved service delivery and sustainable integrated farming practices. The Project takes a point of departure in th

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1.1 Key partners identified and demonstration sites selected
Indicators: - No of EOI received; - List of 7 sites for energy assessments; - 7 partnerships established for conducting EA; - 1 Roadmap for energy need assessments; - 1 energy need assessment reports delivered; - 1 social & environmental impact assessments delivered; - Endorsement of steering comittee representatives for 3-5 selected sites.
Output 1.2 Capacity Built through demonstration projects "Output 1.2 Capacity Built through demonstration projects Indicators: - 3-5 of sites selected; - 3-5 of feasibility studies endorsed; - Equipment that meet quality and cost-efficiency standards procured; - 1 consortium developed from procurement activities - No of capacity need assessments - 1 Ttraining plan and curriculum developed; -. Training of 3-5 institutions on system operation and maintenance - 40 people trained -.1 Operation, maintenance and safety manual developed and disseminated to 3-5 institutions - 80.% of positive evaluation of the training; - 3 operational RETs systems atsystems at the ened of the project
Output 2.1 Tailored mentorship/traineeship program for exchange with China developed & participants trained Indicators: - 3-5 of capacity need assessment reports - 10 trainers N

comment.narrative:
BASELINE
Output 1.1 Key partners identified and demonstration sites selected Baselines: 0
Output 1.2 Capacity Built through demonstration projects Baselines: 0
Output 2.1 Tailored mentorship/traineeship program for exchange with China developed & participants trained Baselines: 0
Output 2.2 Energy Stakeholders in China and Ethiopia are exposed to best business practices in the RE industry Baselines: 0
Output 3 Project Management - Set up project management structures - Host Inception Workshop in Ethiopia - Organize Official Launch of the Project - Recruit Project Manager
-Project Management: Set up project management structures in China -Recruit Project Manager in China -Support the launch Inception Workshop in Ethiopia
-Project management structures in China set up -1 Project Manager in China recruited -Inception Workshop in Ethiopia supported

-Reports targeting the areas on technology assessment of RETs for productive uses, Ethiopia medium and long-term renewable energy supply and demand development plan, Ethiopia energy price and tariff modeling research are under developing. -Conduct private energy service providers mapping in China (biogas, biomass and solar). -Develop online catalogue of suppliers/appliances -Organize Best Practice Workshop -Organize and conduct site visit of successful institutions in China -Develop communication and investment promotion materials -Coordination mechanisms and communication platform established

-The first draft of the report was developed and is in process of finalization in consultation with Ethiopian government counterparts and experts. The report is expected to advise on technology assessment of RETs for productive uses, renewable energy investment plan in Ethiopia and business model of renewable energy technology transfer in Ethiopia. -The mapping of private energy service providers in China (biogas, biomass and solar) is under developing. -The online catalogue of suppliers/appliances is under developing. -Communication materials were developed to enhance the visibility of the project. -The coordination mechanisms and communication platform were further improved, assuring quality and timely project deliverables and information exchanges.

-Develop 1st draft reports targeting the areas on: Technology assessment of RETs for productive uses; Ethiopia medium and long-term renewable energy supply and demand development plan; Ethiopia energy price and tariff modeling research. -Conduct private energy service providers mapping in China (biogas, biomass and solar) -Develop online catalogue of suppliers/appliances

Due to the spreading of COVID-19 globally, the activities are temporarily suspended. The 2020 results are as followed: -1st draft reports targeting the areas on technology assessment of RETs for productive uses, Ethiopia medium and long-term renewable energy supply and demand development plan, Ethiopia energy price and tariff modeling research are under developing. -Private energy service providers mapping in China (biogas, biomass and solar) is under planning -Online catalogue of suppliers/appliances is under planning -Project management structure in China updated with the set up of executive office -UNDP Project team in China are further established and streamlined -Capacity building for Chinese counterparts conducted -The first auditing on the project by OAI conducted

-Finalize the technology assessment report. -Finalize the mapping of private energy service providers in China (biogas, biomass and solar). -Online catalogue of suppliers/appliances to be finalized. -Online training courses to be developed based on the local needs in Ethiopia. -Online best practice workshops to be conducted. -Develop more communication materials to further enhance projects visibility.
